articles.title: DPRK FM Clarifies Principled Stand on Int'l Law
articles.content:
DPRK FM Clarifies Principled Stand on Int'l Law 
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong made a speech at the 53rd Session of the Asian African Legal Consultative Organization (AALCO) on September 15. 
					 He said AALCO has made untiring devotion to the work for representing the interests of its member nations and establishing a fair international legitimate order in the international law arena. 
					
					 In his speech he clarified the principled stand of the DPRK Government on some major issues tabled to the 53rd Session as deliberated item:
					
					 First, the DPR of Korea considers that invoking one's national legislation to impose sanctions on and blockade against a few select states which have different social system is a gross violation running against universal principles of international law which stipulated respect for sovereignty and non-interference in the internal affairs, equality and mutual benefits and guarantee of the freedom of nations in selecting a social system. 
					
					 During the last several decades, the U.S. has applied different kinds of sanctions to my country invoking tens of acts of sanctions. 
					
					 Such an immoral conduct is rooted in pursuing its political aim to stamp out our idea and social system being fueled by sickening feelings of negation and physical antipathy. 
					
					 Second, the DPR of Korea maintains its stand that the UN Security Council resolutions should not be used as a basis for a legislation meant for extraterritorial application by a certain state against another state which has a differing ideology and social system. 
					
					 The U.S. has abused the Security Council resolutions and, basing itself on it, applied sanctions against my country and let third countries follow the resolutions, thus negating outrageously the right of our people to development. 
					
					 All this vividly illustrates that Security Council resolutions catering only for the interests of some big powers in disregard of those of the states concerned are neither in conformity with the demand of the present era for peace and freedom, progress and development nor in line with the UN Charter. 
					
					 Third, the DPR of Korea maintains consistently the stand of opposing with all vehemence all kinds of violent extremism and terrorism as well as any other support for them. 
					
					 We fully support the efforts to create a comprehensive international legal system to oppose violent extremism and terrorism and would actively cooperate for an effective measure.

articles.title: India Will Boost Friendly Relations with DPRK: Indian President
articles.content:
India Will Boost Friendly Relations with DPRK: Indian President
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Kye Chun Yong, DPRK ambassador to India, presented his credentials to Indian President Pranab Mukherjee on Sept. 12. 
					 The Indian president said:
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have a long historical tradition. 
					
					 It is the stand of India to boost the friendly relations with the DPRK. 
					
					 I am pleased that the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries was celebrated last year. 
					
					 India asserts that the tension on the Korean peninsula and the issue of Korea's reunification should be settled through reconciliation, cooperation, dialogue and negotiation. 
					
					 I wish the government and people of the DPRK fresh success in their efforts to build an economic power.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Visits Italy
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Visits Italy
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) visited Italy from September 14 to 16. It was led by Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK. 
					 During his visit Kang Sok Ju respectively met and had conversations  with the vice-president of the Senate of Italy, the chairman of the Forza Italia Group of the Senate, the chairman of the Northern League Group of the Chamber of Deputies and others concerned of the Parliament, and the chairman of the Italian General Investment Group. 
					
					 He also held talks with a member of the Leadership of the Democratic Party of Italy and the general secretary of the Communist Party of Italy respectively. 
					
					 At the conversations and talks they exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly relations between the two countries in various fields and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 9th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sept. 18.
					  They paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They entered the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state and paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and the halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives. 
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a letter of thanks from the participants in the 9th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair on Sept. 18.
					 The letter said the book fair was successfully held in conformity with its purpose and mission thanks to the positive efforts and cooperation rendered by publishing houses, libraries, scientific research institutes and universities of different countries around the world, international organizations, missions of foreign countries and international organizations here.
					
					 Successes of the latest science and technology were widely introduced and experience exchanged during the book fair. And there was a deep-going discussion of the issues of expanding and strengthening the exchange and cooperation in the field of science and technology, it noted.
					
					 The book fair is conducive to achieving the progress and prosperity common to mankind by developing exchange and cooperation of science and technology and deepening friendship among countries, it said.
					
					 It expressed sincere thanks to Kim Jong Un for showing deep attention and solicitude for the book fair.
					
					 It expressed belief that the DPRK would successfully emerge as a world-level scientific and technological power and a highly civilized state in the near future under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It stressed the need to briskly conduct scientific and technological exchange and cooperation through the book fair in the future, too.

articles.title: Birthday Party Given for Participants in Meeting of Primary Organization Cadres of Youth League
articles.content:
Birthday Party Given for Participants in Meeting of Primary Organization Cadres of Youth League
						
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A birthday party was given at April 25 Hotel on Thursday in honor of participants in the 4th meeting of primary organization cadres of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					 Officials of the youth league were present at the party together with the participants who greeted their birthdays during the meeting.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league, said that Marshal Kim Jong Un, who has always paid deep attention to the work of the youth league, showed such loving care as making sure that a birthday party was given for the participants who greeted their birthdays during the meeting.
					
					 This care of Kim Jong Un reflects his deep trust and great expectation that primary organization cadres of the youth league would become reliable political cadres and ardent young commanding personnel, he noted.

articles.title: Officials of UAWK Hold Seminar
articles.content:
Officials of UAWK Hold Seminar
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A seminar on education in Kim Jong Il's patriotism, faith, working class viewpoint and morality was held by officials of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday.
					 Present there were officials concerned and officials of the union.
					
					 The participants heard papers on the significance of the idea enunciated by Marshal Kim Jong Un on the four-point education and the tasks and ways of dynamically conducting the education among the members of the union as intended by the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Speakers said Kim Jong Un defined the four-point education as the main task of ideological education and thus provided the organizations of the union with the guidelines for effectively conducting the education among its members by closely combining the education with the practice of the Korean revolution.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's patriotism means the warmest and ardent love for the country and its  people and the most positive and self-sacrificing devotion for the prosperity of the country and the people's happiness, they said, adding that all members of the union should bear in mind Kim Jong Il's patriotism and thoroughly apply it to the practical activities.
					
					 They called for cherishing the loyalty to the party and the leader as the revolutionary faith and glorifying the fervent loyalty to Kim Jong Un in the practical struggles.
					
					 They underlined the need to strengthen the education in working class viewpoint in order to firmly protect the ideology and social system in the DPRK, culture and lifestyle and glorify them.
					
					 The education in socialist morality is the ideological education to let people have noble and beautiful moral trait befitting a highly civilized nation, they said, calling for applying noble moral trait to the work and life.
					
					 They called upon all organizations of the union and its officials to know well about the significance and importance of the idea indicated by Kim Jong Un on the four-point education and fulfill their duty in the efforts to bring earlier the final victory for the building a thriving nation.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Presentation Held
articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Presentation Held
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The national scientific and technological presentation in the field of hydro-meteorology and marine science was held here on Wednesday and Thursday under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians, teachers, postgraduates and officials of Kim Il Sung University, the Hydro-meteorological Service, the Maritime Administration of the DPRK and other units of hydro-meteorology and marine science and relevant units.
					
					 The participants heard at least 80 papers dealing with successes conducive to putting meteorological observation and forecast on a scientific basis and developing marine industry.
					
					 Drawing the attention of the participants were many pieces of information about researches and proposals which are of significance in improving forecast technology and method and developing and actively harnessing marine resources as required by the developing reality, including the establishment of real-time informing system of hydro-meteorology forecast and researches into long-term marine change and marine organisms.

articles.title: Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Closes
articles.content:
Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Closes
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The 9th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair closed with due ceremony at the Grand People's Study House on Thursday.
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is also chairwoman of the organizing committee of the book fair, officials concerned, teachers, researches, delegations and delegates of different countries, international organizations and overseas Koreans and staff members of foreign embassies and international organizations here.
					
					 Certificates were awarded and souvenirs conveyed to organizations which contributed books and information presented to the book fair.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk said in a closing address that the participants exchanged achievements and experience gained in the fields of science, technology and media and conducted brisk exchange of publications.
					
					 She noted that the DPRK would as ever boost scientific and technological exchange and cooperation with different countries in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: DPRK Football Team Advances into Finals at 2014 AFC U-16 Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Football Team Advances into Finals at 2014 AFC U-16 Championship
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK men's football team advanced into the finals of the 2014 AFC U-16 Championship now under way in Thailand.
					 The DPRK team defeated its Australian rival 5:2 in the semi-finals on September 17.
					
					 It will play the finals on Sept. 20.

articles.title: DPRK Football Team Advances into Knock-out Stage
articles.content:
DPRK Football Team Advances into Knock-out Stage
 Inchon, September 18 (KCNA-Correspondent) -- The DPRK men's eleven played league match with Pakistani rival in the 17th Asian Games on Thursday. 
					 So Kyong Jin scored the first goal in penalty kick at the 40th minute of the match. 
					
					 Jong Il Gwan headed the ball into the Pakistani goal mouth at the 68th minute of the match. 
					
					 The DPRK team thus won the match 2:0.
					
					 The DPRK team placed the first in the group and advanced into the knock-out stage.

articles.title: Tennis Competition of Officials Held
articles.content:
Tennis Competition of Officials Held
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- A tennis competition among officials of commissions, ministries and national institutions took place in Rungna Islet of the DPRK from Sept. 16 to 18.
					 The players fully demonstrated their technique.
					
					 The Ministry of Chemical Industry, General Bureau of Pleasure Park, Kyonghung Guidance Bureau and Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea respectively came first in their groups.

articles.title: DPRK: Efforts Paid to Improve People's Livelihood
articles.content:
DPRK: Efforts Paid to Improve People's Livelihood
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Big efforts have been paid to improve people's livelihood in all parts of the DPRK.
					 Cholwon County in Kangwon Province expanded the capacity of a mushroom farm 10 times bigger than the exiting one, in an aim to make a contribution to improving the dietary life of the county residents.
					
					 Paekam County in Ryanggang Province finished building 15 blocks of greenhouses in its township, paving a way to supply various species of vegetables to the residents even in winter season.
					
					 The Sinuiju Knitwear Factory in North Phyongan Province has witnessed production upsurge by channeling big efforts to technical innovation.
					
					 Myongchon County, North Hamgyong Province improved water service network in its township to adequately ensure the supply of water to its inhabitants.

articles.title: S. Korean People Protest against Establishment of MD
articles.content:
S. Korean People Protest against Establishment of MD
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held peace rallies in Seoul on Sept. 16 in protest against the U.S. moves to build the missile defense system.
					 Speakers, addressing the rallies, referred to the fact that a south Korea-U.S. high-level meeting was to be held at the Ministry of Defense that day. 
					
					 They said that the meeting would decide on the issue of extending the transfer of the right to command wartime operation for an indefinite period until the establishment of the MD is completed.
					
					 They demanded the authorities clarify the stand opposing the indefinite extension of the transfer of the right.
					
					 If THAAD is deployed in south Korea, it will turn into an advanced base for the operation based on this system and thus escalate conflict in Northeast Asia.
					
					 It is the military agreement to be concluded among south Korea, the U.S. and Japan in the form of MOU that will provide an institutional guarantee for the establishment of the MD, they noted.
					
					 The agreement will make the military ties between south Korea and Japan involve intelligence, operations and logistics and help knock into shape a triangular military alliance in fact, they charged.
					
					 They demanded an immediate halt to the moves to conclude the agreement.

articles.title: GIs Violence Unabated in S. Korea
articles.content:
GIs Violence Unabated in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- GIs belonging to the 2nd Division of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces committed ceaseless violence in Kyonggi Province, south Korea.
					 A sergeant of U.S. forces sexually abused a south Korean woman in Phochon on Sept. 15, wringing her neck.
					
					 In Uijongbu on Sept. 7, a GI molested a woman on her way and when she offered resistance, he took her by the wrist and pushed her to a wall. 
					
					 In Uijongbu on Sept. 2, a drunken GI belonging to a company of the headquarters of the division cruelly assaulted a south Korean taxi driver, seriously wounding him.
					
					 This unending GI violence once again proves that U.S. forces are a herd of beasts and criminals bringing constant misfortune and pain to the south Korean people.

articles.title: S. Korean Teachers' Rally Held in Seoul
articles.content:
S. Korean Teachers' Rally Held in Seoul
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Teachers of south Korea held a rally in Seoul on September 13 demanding the institution of a special law on probing the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster, according to Nodong and Segye, a paper of south Korea.
					 What the people want is to institute a special law on probing the truth, speakers said, insisting that a clarification should be made of why the disaster occurred, claiming many casualties, and why so many children were not rescued.
					
					 Teachers are, however, subject to suppression for having struggled in demand of the probe into the truth and the punishment of those responsible for the disaster, they deplored.
					
					 A resolution was read out at the rally. It denounced the chief executive for evading the blame for the disaster and the political camp for regarding the institution of a special law as a lever for political bargaining.
					
					 At the end of the rally the participants held a memorial service for the victims and those missing.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked in Italy
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked in Italy 
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The Rome Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Idea of Italy and the Italy-DPRK Association for Friendship and Solidarity released a joint statement on September 10 to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 The joint statement said:
					
					 The DPRK has consolidated its socialist system and waged a dynamic struggle for independence and peace, standing by the world progressive. 
					
					 After the Soviet Union and other East European socialist countries collapsed late in the last century, the DPRK defended the idea of socialism under the leadership of Kim Jong Il by waging a fierce struggle to foil the U.S. and other imperialists' moves and weather all difficulties and meet their challenges. 
					
					 Today the world envies the DPRK, a nuclear weapons state capable of beating any formidable enemy and its socialist system which guarantees the popular masses genuine rights through free education and healthcare.
					
					 Under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un the DPRK will as ever dynamically advance to build a proud, happy and thriving nation under the uplifted flag of the DPRK and red flag of socialism.

articles.title: Egypt-DPRK Solidarity Day Marked
articles.content:
Egypt-DPRK Solidarity Day Marked
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- An event of Egypt-DPRK Solidarity Day took place in Al Gharbiya Province under the sponsorship of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association on Sept. 6 to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 Present there were personages of the Egyptian national preparatory committee for celebrating the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK, the Ministry of Sports and the Ministry of Supply and people of different social standings in Al Gharbiya Province. The DPRK ambassador to Egypt and his embassy officials were present there on invitation. 
					
					 On display at the venue of the event were photos documenting exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and their works and books introducing Songun Korea. 
					
					 Speakers highly praised the exploits Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed for the Korean revolution and the global cause of independence. 
					
					 They expressed the belief that under the leadership of Kim Jong Un the Korean people would surely win the final victory in the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle as they advance, holding aloft the banner of Songun.

articles.title: Guinean Organization Discloses U.S. Aim at Permanent Presence of Its Forces in S. Korea
articles.content:
Guinean Organization Discloses U.S. Aim at Permanent Presence of Its Forces in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- The Guinea-Korea Friendship Association released a bulletin on Sept. 8, 69 years since the U.S. forces occupied south Korea. 
					 The bulletin in an article titled "Why are the U.S. forces present in south Korea" said that the U.S. forces illegally occupied south Korea on Sept. 8, 1945, nearly seven decades ago and they still remain in south Korea, querying why do they stay in south Korea though it is not their land.
					
					 In articles subtitled "Results of hegemonic ambition", "Illegal occupation" the bulletin cited facts that after illegally hurling its troops into south Korea under the pretext of "disarming" the defeated Japanese army, the U.S. long eyed the Korean peninsula, 
					
					 Another article sub-titled "Trick for permanent troop presence" said:
					
					 The U.S. used the puppet government of Syngman Rhee of south Korea to justify the permanent presence of the U.S. troops in south Korea. 
					
					 Since the ceasefire in the last Korean War the U.S. has steadily reinforced its troops present in south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. has not implemented the resolution of the 30th UN General Assembly calling for disbanding the "UN Command" and forcing all foreign forces present in south Korea under the UN flag to withdraw from it. 
					
					 As the justification for the U.S. forces' permanent presence in south Korea worked no longer after the demise of the Cold War era and the collapse of the Soviet Union, the U.S. began noisily talking about "threat from north Korea". 
					
					 The U.S. ceaselessly stages an adventurous test nuclear war and preliminary war against the DPRK, rendering the situation on the Korean peninsula extremely tense. This is aimed at the permanent presence of its troops in south Korea.

articles.title: Presidente irani aprecia historicas relaciones de amistad con la RPDC
articles.content:
Presidente irani aprecia historicas relaciones de amistad con la RPDC
						
Teheran, 16 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Hassan Rouhani, converso el dia 16 en una atmosfera amistosa con el canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong.
					En la ocasion el mandatario subrayo que ambos paises tienen historicas y tradicionales relaciones de amistad que ha establecido y cimentado el Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Prosiguio que esos vinculos se desarrollaron en una etapa mas alta bajo la profunda atencion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Dijo estar complacido de que gracias a Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un, las excelentes relaciones de ambos paises se desarrollaran positivamente.
					
					Senalo que Iran presta profunda atencion a la paz y seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region.
					
					A pesar de las acciones de las fuerzas hostiles, se lograran sin falta la paz y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region bajo la sabia guia de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un, aseguro.

articles.title: Canciller de RPDC se reune con varias personalidades en Iran
articles.content:
Canciller de RPDC se reune con varias personalidades en Iran
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, quien realiza una visita oficial y de amistad a Iran y participa en la 53a reunion de la Organizacion de Negociaciones Juridicas de Asia y Africa, se reunio el dia 15 con el vicepresidente de Iran y el secretario general de esa organizacion e intercambio las opiniones sobre una serie de problemas de interes mutuo.
					Ese dia, Ri departio por separado con los ministros de Justicia de Iran, Palestina, Sri Lanka y Jordania y el presidente del Tribunal Supremo del Libano.

articles.title: Presidente indio expresa posicion de desarrollar relaciones bilaterales con RPDC
articles.content:
Presidente indio expresa posicion de desarrollar relaciones bilaterales con RPDC
						
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Republica de la India, Pranab Mukherjee, recibio el dia 12 las cartas credenciales del nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en ese pais, Kye Chun Yong.
					En la ocasion el mandatario dijo que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises tienen tradiciones historicas.
					
					Prosiguio que la India tiene la posicion de ampliar y desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad con la RPDC.
					
					Dijo estar complacido de que en el ano pasado, se ha conmemorado el 40o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre los dos paises.
					
					La India exige en que se debe resolver el problema de tension de la Peninsula Coreana y de reunificacion de Corea a traves de la reconciliacion y cooperacion, el dialogo y negociaciones, subrayo.
					
					Deseo nuevos exitos en la lucha del gobierno y pueblo coreanos por construir una potencia economica.

articles.title: Delegacion del PTC visita Italia
articles.content:
Delegacion del PTC visita Italia
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, presidida por Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central de la misma organizacion, visito del dia 14 al 16 la Republica de Italia.
					Durante la visita, Kang departio por separado con el vicepresidente del senado y otras personalidades del Parlamento de Italia y el presidente del Grupo Italiano de Inversion General.
					
					Kang converso tambien por separado con el miembro de la direccion del Partido Democratico de Italia y el secretario general del Partido Comunista de Italia.
					
					En las ocasiones tuvo lugar el intercambio de opiniones sobre el problema de ampliar y desarrollar en varias ramas las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Clausurada XII Exhibicion Nacional de Vestidos Coreanos
articles.content:
Clausurada XII Exhibicion Nacional de Vestidos Coreanos
						
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 15 al 17 en la capitalina Casa Central de la Juventud la XII exhibicion nacional de vestidos coreanos bajo el tema de "Ropaje del Estado civilizado socialista".
					Fueron exhibidos en la ocasion mas de 700 vestimentas y mas de 500 vestidos estacionales, presentados por los tecnicos, obreros calificados y maestros de la rama de confeccion de ropas, y las gremiales de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea.
					
					Segun los miembros del jurado, en la exhibicion se presentaron los vestidos mejorados segun la demanda y estetica de la epoca actual.
					
					Las ciudades y las provincias, en particular, la ciudad de Pyongyang y las provincias de Hamgyong del Sur y Phyong-an del Norte, exhibieron las prendas elegantes que resaltan las caracteristicas locales.
					
					Atrajeron la atencion de los visitantes las ropas estacionales como trajes de la mujer y camisas.
					
					En el marco de la exhibicion, tuvieron lugar la presentacion y la de divulgacion de ropas ejemplares.
					
					Ademas, tuvieron lugar el seminario sobre los problemas que se presentan en el diseno, confeccion y creacion de formas, la exposicion de experiencias y el cursillo.
					
					Se otorgaron la bandera de ganador y la copa a las entidades y los participantes sobresalientes.

articles.title: Tiene lugar seminario de funcionarios de UTAC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar seminario de funcionarios de UTAC
						
Pyongyang, 18 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 18 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el seminario de los funcionarios de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea (UTAC) sobre la educacion en el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il, la conviccion, la clasista y la moral. 
					Participaron los funcionarios interesados y los de la UTAC.
					
					En la ocasion se presentaron las monografias que argumentan la importancia de la idea del Mariscal Kim Jong Un en materia de la educacion de 4 tipos susodichos y enumeran las tareas y remedios para dinamizarla entre los miembros de la UTAC acorde al proposito del partido. 
					
					Los oradores senalaron que el Mariscal determino la educacion de 4 tipos como tarea principal de la educacion ideologica, de manera que se preparara la guia directriz para desarrollar con eficiencia la educacion para los miembros de la UTAC en combinacion estrecha con las practicas de la revolucion coreana. 
					
					El patriotismo de Kim Jong Il es el amor mas calido por la patria y el pueblo y es la abnegacion mas activa y de sacrificio, dijeron e insistieron en asimilarlo en lo profundo del corazon y materializarlo en la practica. 
					
					Subrayaron la necesidad de guardar la fidelidad al partido y al lider como una conviccion revolucionaria y manifestar en la practica la fidelidad al Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Apuntaron que se debe intensificar la educacion clasista para defender con firmeza la ideologia, el regimen, la cultura y el modo de vida de la RPDC.
					
					La educacion moral socialista es la ideologica para poseer las nobles y hermosas cualidades morales convenientes a la fisonomia del pais civilizado socialista, afirmaron y agregaron que todos deben mostrar en el trabajo y la vida las nobles cualidades morales. 
					
					Llamaron a todas las organizaciones y funcionarios de la UTAC a cumplir con su deber en la construccion de un Estado prospero teniendo presente la importancia y el significado de la idea mencionada del Mariscal.
